title: After EU elections, weakened France seeks to limit loss of influence in Brussels
summary: MEPs with Emmanuel Macron's Renew group hope to limit the consequences of the far-right's gains in the European elections, with only three weeks to go before France's shock parliamentary election.

title: French conservative party leader backs alliance with Le Pen, prompting backlash
summary: The president of Les Républicains, Eric Ciotti, said he thinks his party should form an alliance with the far-right Rassemblement National. He then rejected calls to resign after widespread opposition among key figures in his own party.

title: 'Has Macron gone mad?': International press reacts to the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale
summary: Foreign media are trying to understand the president's decision to dissolve the Assemblée in light of the Rassemblement National's historic breakthrough in the European Parliament.

title: French left agrees to form new 'Popular Front' in parliamentary elections
summary: The French left, including the Greens and radical left Jean-Luc Mélenchon's La France Insoumise, agreed to form a coalition on Monday evening. But the question remains as to who will lead the alliance into the battle of the snap elections called by President Macron.

title: Why Macron decided to call snap elections
summary: A small group of close confidants quietly worked on this high-risk scenario. Allies of former president Nicolas Sarkozy pushed President Macron to take the plunge. Sunday's catastrophic score in the European elections precipitated the decision.

title: Snap elections in France: How it works, precedents, and consequences
summary: Following the far-right Rassemblement National's sweeping victory in the European elections, Emmanuel Macron has decided to dissolve to the Assemblée Nationale for the first time since 1997.

title: 'Narendra Modi's weakened position jeopardizes crony capitalism in India'
summary: The low score achieved by the prime minister's party came as a surprise to India's major companies, which largely depend on public orders and political 'favors,' observed Julien Bouissou in his column.

title: UN: violence against children reached 'extreme levels' in 2023, citing Gaza and others
summary: The report comes days after the international organization placed Israeli forces and Hamas on its blacklist of countries and groups that violate children's rights.

title: Hunter Biden convicted of three felony charges in gun trial
summary: A jury found Hunter Biden guilty on Tuesday on federal gun charges in a historic first criminal prosecution of the child of a sitting US president.

title: Ukraine in shock after the resignation of a reconstruction official
summary: On the eve of an international conference on reconstruction, a senior official condemns the 'resistance and artificial obstacles' put in the way of his work.

title: Washington Post confronts major existential crisis
summary: The readership of the American newspaper has fallen by half since the Trump years, its finances are in the red and the executive editor has been sacked as part of a scandal tainting the paper's boss.

title: Malawi's vice president and 9 others have died in a plane crash, president says
summary: The military plane carrying Malawi's Vice President Saulos Chilima and nine others went missing Monday.

title: 'I saw fear tonight': Paris banlieue mayors' worries after Macron calls snap elections
summary: Mayors from around the Paris region spoke to Le Monde about the shock caused by the French president's decision to dissolve the Assemblée Nationale. They warn of the consequences for working-class neighborhoods if the far right triumphs.

title: Martial arts film awakens nostalgia for pre-Chinese Hong Kong
summary: Greeted with immense enthusiasm by the public, 'Twilight of the Warriors' is set in the walled city of Kowloon, a place now destroyed but symbolizing a vanished spirit of freedom.

title: Russian officials call Macron and Scholz 'illegitimate' after EU election setbacks
summary: Russian politicians and commentators say the European election results in France and Germany disqualify their leaders and welcome the breakthrough by far-right parties.

title: 2024 European elections: What's the profile of the average French MEP?
summary: Eighty-one MEPs were elected on Sunday, including some young people, many first-timers and a handful of experienced politicians.

title: King Charles' new portrait vandalized by animal rights activists
summary: Animal Rising covered the official portrait of King Charles III with the face of a cartoon character. They wanted to highlight the mistreatment of animals on RSCPA-approved farms, of which the King is the patron.

title: Château de Versailles briefly evacuated after fire breaks out
summary: The fire was brought under control and visitors were able to return. No one was injured and there was no damage to the collections.

title: Watch: Who won the European elections in each country?
summary: Le Monde analyzes the current results in the bloc's 27 member states, which point to a breakthrough for the far right all over Europe.

title: 'For Macron, snap elections are the ultimate attempt to spark momentum'
summary: By dissolving the Assemblée Nationale, the French president runs the risk of giving an absolute majority to the Rassemblement National. Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz points out that trying to govern with a far-right party would raise moral concerns.

title: 'The spread of the RN vote reflects a social malaise that goes beyond the issue of racism'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, political scientist Luc Rouban examines how the Rassemblement National moved away from the traditional factors influencing the far-right vote in the European elections.

title: Pop culture icon Françoise Hardy has died
summary: The singer died on June 11, at the age of 80. The star of the yéyé years leaves a legacy of masterpieces for French chanson.

title: Hong Kong cancels passports of six 'lawless' democracy activists
summary: Authorities accuse the six 'criminals' of engaging in activities that endanger national security.

title: A 17th-century synagogue in Belarus has been sold for 12 euros
summary: A Baroque art gem, Slonim's synagogue, the country's second oldest, has been deteriorating since the end of the Second World War. At a new auction, the building was sold to a Russian entrepreneur. Concerns remain over its restoration.

title: After calling snap elections, weakened Macron heads to series of international summits
summary: The political instability caused by the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale and the RN's historic breakthrough in the European elections is sending shockwaves through France's partners and allies.

title: Biden camp shows respect for justice after his son's conviction for illegally acquiring a firearm
summary: Hunter Biden was convicted of concealing his drug addiction when purchasing a firearm. Joe Biden rejected any prospect of a presidential pardon.

title: The French conservative party leader surrendered to the far right
summary: The alliance with the far-right Rassemblement National advocated by the president of the Les Républicains party for the legislative elections is more than a transgression.

title: Macron calls on all those 'able to say no to extremes' to back him
summary: The French president said he did not 'want to give the keys to power to the far right in 2027,' during a press conference on Wednesday after calling snap elections.

title: Bardella goes back on promise to repeal Macron's pension reform
summary: Eager to appear 'reasonable' on the economic front, the far-right leader said that 'choices will have to be made' in the event of his party's victory in the parliamentary elections.

title: European elections: Across traditionally hostile Brittany, Le Pen's RN made a historic breakthrough
summary: In the historically Europhile and moderate region, the far right won the June 9 elections for the first time. The left resisted better than elsewhere, outperforming President Emmanuel Macron's coalition.

title: Four industries are responsible for 2.7 million deaths each year in Europe, WHO says
summary: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization's Europe office published a report denouncing the way in which the tobacco, alcohol, ultra-processed food and fossil fuel industries are obstructing health policies.

title: What's the history behind France's far-right Rassemblement National party?
summary: Formerly known as the Front National, the far-right party was founded in 1972 by a neo-fascist group. It achieved historic success in France's EU elections on June 9, garnering 31.5% of the vote.

title: European election results: A more conservative Parliament under pressure from far right
summary: The mainstream conservative parties are set to come under pressure from the far-right in Parliament after the European elections saw their record gains, particularly in France and Germany, and the collapse of the Greens.

title: Le Pen on track to dismantle the French right
summary: By agreeing to forge an alliance with the far right, the leader of the conservative party has crossed a line, fulfilling the personal objective of Jean-Marie Le Pen's daughter.

title: Blinken says US will try to bridge Israel-Hamas gaps on deal
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that mediators would keep trying to close an elusive ceasefire deal after Hamas proposed numerous changes to a US-backed proposal.

title: Three Jordanian doctors' account of Gaza's descent into hell
summary: The kingdom runs two hospitals in the Palestinian territory. Military doctors, who spent over three months there since the war began, described the extremely harsh conditions under which the sick and wounded are treated.
